Materials Needed: Objects to hide.
Steps to Follow:
• Hide objects and find clues.
• Pretend to be AI detectives.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn about clues and patterns.
What is Gained:
• Observation
• Logical thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Pattern Match
Materials Needed: Pattern cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Find matching cards.
• Explain how AI finds matches.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand pattern recognition.
What is Gained:
• Memory
• Analysis skills

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI predicts weather.
topics.Explanation:
• AI watches clouds and wind. 
• It guesses if it will rain or shine. 
• Helps plan days better.
topics.Activity 1:
Weather Watch
Materials Needed: Weather chart.
Steps to Follow:
• Observe weather daily.
• Predict tomorrow’s weather.
• Compare with actual.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice prediction.
What is Gained:
• Observation
• Reasoning
topics.Activity 2:
Cloud Detectives
Materials Needed: Photos of clouds.
Steps to Follow:
• Identify cloud types.
• Learn what they mean.
What Should Be Achieved:
Link clouds to weather.
What is Gained:
• Science interest
• Critical thinking

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI helps animals and nature.
topics.Explanation:
• AI tracks animals to keep them safe. 
• It studies how animals live. 
• Helps protect wildlife.
topics.Activity 1:
Animal Tracker
Materials Needed: Pictures of animals.
Steps to Follow:
• Identify animals in pictures.
• Talk about AI helping track.
What Should Be Achieved:
Connect AI and animals.
What is Gained:
• Animal knowledge
• Care for nature
topics.Activity 2:
Nature Walk
Materials Needed: Notebook, pencil.
Steps to Follow:
• Walk outside to observe animals.
• Record what is seen.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice observation skills.
What is Gained:
• Patience
• Environmental awareness

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To imagine how AI can help learn about the past.
topics.Explanation:
• AI studies old pictures and data. 
• It helps understand history. 
• Makes learning fun.
topics.Activity 1:
History Puzzle
Materials Needed: Old photos or drawings.
Steps to Follow:
• Look at old pictures.
• Talk about what they show.
• Pretend AI helps explain.
What Should Be Achieved:
Connect AI to history.
What is Gained:
• Curiosity
• Critical thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Timeline Game
Materials Needed: Cards with events.
Steps to Follow:
• Put events in order.
• Explain with AI’s help.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand sequence of events.
What is Gained:
• Memory
• Logical thinking

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI helps explore space.
topics.Explanation:
• AI controls rovers and satellites. 
• It sends back information. 
• Helps scientists learn more.
topics.Activity 1:
Rover Explorer
Materials Needed: Toy rover or box.
Steps to Follow:
• Pretend to explore another planet.
• Avoid obstacles and find samples.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn about AI in space.
What is Gained:
• Motor skills
• Space knowledge
topics.Activity 2:
What AI Sees
Materials Needed: Satellite images.
Steps to Follow:
• Look at images and guess what AI sees.
• Talk about Earth shapes.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice observation.
What is Gained:
• Visual thinking
• Space interest

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI solves complex puzzles.
topics.Explanation:
• AI tries many moves to solve puzzles. 
• It learns from mistakes. 
• Helps in games and research.
topics.Activity 1:
Puzzle Solver
Materials Needed: Simple puzzles or blocks.
Steps to Follow:
• Try to solve puzzles step-by-step.
• Talk about AI trying again if stuck.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand AI learning.
What is Gained:
• Persistence
• Problem-solving
topics.Activity 2:
Move It Right
Materials Needed: Board game or cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Play a simple game.
• Think about best moves like AI.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice decision making.
What is Gained:
• Strategy
• Critical thinking
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To help children see how AI finds patterns in things.
topics.Explanation:
• AI looks for patterns in colors, sounds, or actions. 
 • These patterns help it learn and guess what comes next. 
 • It’s like solving puzzles!
topics.Activity 1:
Pattern Detective
Materials Needed: Beads, colored paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Make a color pattern like red-blue-red-blue.
• Ask the child to continue it.
• Try new patterns: size, shape, or number.
What Should Be Achieved:
Spot and follow patterns.
What is Gained:
• Logical thinking
• Visual memory
topics.Activity 2:
What Comes Next?
Materials Needed: Printed shape sequences.
Steps to Follow:
• Show shape pattern cards.
• Child guesses the next shape.
• Explain how AI guesses using patterns.
What Should Be Achieved:
Predict based on learned rules.
What is Gained:
• Reasoning
• Intro to AI learning
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI understands sounds and words.
topics.Explanation:
• AI listens to voices and sounds. 
 • It turns sound into text or action. 
 • Voice assistants use this skill.
topics.Activity 1:
Echo Game
Materials Needed: None.
Steps to Follow:
• Say a sentence clearly.
• Child repeats like an AI.
• Talk about how AI “hears” to repeat.
What Should Be Achieved:
Mimic speech understanding.
What is Gained:
• Sound clarity
• Listening skills
topics.Activity 2:
Sound Sorter
Materials Needed: Sound clips or mimic voices.
Steps to Follow:
• Play or make animal and object sounds.
• Ask the child to group them.
• Talk about how AI knows differences.
What Should Be Achieved:
Grouping by sound.
What is Gained:
• Categorization
• Auditory awareness
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To show how AI creates pictures using ideas.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can draw from words or parts of images. 
 • It learns styles and adds details. 
 • It imagines like an artist!
topics.Activity 1:
Style Mix-Up
Materials Needed: Pictures of art styles (cartoon, realistic).
Steps to Follow:
• Show different art styles.
• Ask child to mix them in one drawing.
• Compare how AI blends styles.
What Should Be Achieved:
Create using mixed patterns.
What is Gained:
• Artistic exploration
• Visual learning
topics.Activity 2:
Word to Picture
Materials Needed: Words like “robot dog,” “flying tree.”
Steps to Follow:
• Say a funny combo.
• Child draws it.
• Discuss how AI turns words into images.
What Should Be Achieved:
Visualizing from description.
What is Gained:
• Imagination
• Conceptual thinking
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Topic: AI and the Magic of Sorting
topics.Objective: To teach how AI groups similar things together.
topics.Explanation:
• AI learns by sorting objects by features. 
 • It can group by color, shape, sound, or more. 
 • Helps in organizing big data.
topics.Activity 1:
Shape Cluster
Materials Needed: Blocks of different shapes.
Steps to Follow:
• Spread blocks randomly.
• Child sorts into groups.
• Compare to AI sorting data.
What Should Be Achieved:
Sort by logic.
What is Gained:
• Grouping skill
• Understanding classification
topics.Activity 2:
Odd One Out
Materials Needed: Toy sets with one mismatch.
Steps to Follow:
• Show 3 similar, 1 odd item.
• Ask child to spot the odd one.
• Talk about how AI learns this.
What Should Be Achieved:
Spotting anomalies.
What is Gained:
• Attention to detail
• Pattern spotting
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To introduce the idea of how AI stores and recalls data.
topics.Explanation:
• AI keeps memories in its system. 
 • It uses past data to make decisions. 
 • This helps it learn over time.
topics.Activity 1:
Memory Match
Materials Needed: Memory card game.
Steps to Follow:
• Flip cards and find pairs.
• Relate this to how AI remembers.
• Ask child how remembering helps decisions.
What Should Be Achieved:
Memory as learning.
What is Gained:
• Short-term memory
• AI comparison
topics.Activity 2:
Recall Robot
Materials Needed: Drawn symbols or objects.
Steps to Follow:
• Show 5 items for 10 seconds.
• Hide and ask child to recall.
• Compare with how AI saves info.
What Should Be Achieved:
Retain and recall.
What is Gained:
• Focus
• Retention skills
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how chatbots talk with people.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can answer questions like a human. 
 • It uses words it learned from reading. 
 • Used in phones and websites.
topics.Activity 1:
Build a Bot Chat
Materials Needed: Paper and pencil.
Steps to Follow:
• Child creates a paper chatbot face.
• You ask questions; they reply like a bot.
• Discuss how bots think before replying.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice bot logic.
What is Gained:
• Role-play
• Understanding AI logic
topics.Activity 2:
Right Reply
Materials Needed: Question flashcards.
Steps to Follow:
• Show a question.
• Give 3 reply choices.
• Ask child to choose best answer.
What Should Be Achieved:
Choose context replies.
What is Gained:
• Context learning
• Decision-making
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To introduce the idea of emotional AI.
topics.Explanation:
• Some AIs try to read emotions. 
 • They look at faces, voices, and words. 
 • It helps them act kindly.
topics.Activity 1:
Face Feelings
Materials Needed: Emotion flashcards.
Steps to Follow:
• Show happy, sad, angry faces.
• Ask child to guess the feeling.
• Talk about how AI guesses emotions.
What Should Be Achieved:
Recognize feelings.
What is Gained:
• Empathy
• Observation
topics.Activity 2:
Voice Mood
Materials Needed: Say sentences in different tones.
Steps to Follow:
• Say “I’m fine” in happy/sad/angry tone.
• Ask child to guess mood.
• Link to how AI hears feelings.
What Should Be Achieved:
Spot tone changes.
What is Gained:
• Listening skills
• Emotional learning
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explain how AI makes true/false choices.
topics.Explanation:
• AI often answers yes/no or true/false. 
 • It uses logic rules to decide. 
 • Like flipping switches in its brain.
topics.Activity 1:
Logic Switch
Materials Needed: Flashcards with questions.
Steps to Follow:
• Ask simple questions: “Is sky blue?”
• Child answers yes or no.
• Explain how AI decides similarly.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand logic checks.
What is Gained:
• Decision logic
• Truth reasoning
topics.Activity 2:
If-Then Fun
Materials Needed: Paper and pen.
Steps to Follow:
• Write “If I clap, then you jump.”
• Try different if-then combos.
• Explain AI also uses such rules.
What Should Be Achieved:
Action based on logic.
What is Gained:
• Rule-following
• Logical play
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To show how AI learns by training.
topics.Explanation:
• AI doesn’t know things at first. 
 • We teach it using examples. 
 • The more we teach, the better it gets.
topics.Activity 1:
Picture Trainer
Materials Needed: Photos of animals.
Steps to Follow:
• Show 3 cat photos, 3 dogs.
• Ask child to teach AI to tell them apart.
• Use “This is a cat” etc.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand training process.
What is Gained:
• Teaching skill
• Categorization
topics.Activity 2:
AI Learns Names
Materials Needed: Family photo cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Say each person’s name with a photo.
• Ask AI (you) to recall.
• Talk about how AI improves.
What Should Be Achieved:
AI memory builds.
What is Gained:
• Memory logic
• Pattern naming
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI creates new things from ideas.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can write poems, stories, or make songs. 
 • It mixes learning with creativity. 
 • Like a digital imagination.
topics.Activity 1:
Story Starter
Materials Needed: Word cards (place, person, thing).
Steps to Follow:
• Pick 3 cards: “Forest,” “Robot,” “Pizza.”
• Child makes a story.
• Say AI does the same with words.
What Should Be Achieved:
Create from pieces.
What is Gained:
• Creativity
• Word play
topics.Activity 2:
Music Maker
Materials Needed: Simple beat-making app or claps.
Steps to Follow:
• Make a beat pattern.
• Ask child to add a twist.
• Discuss how AI composes like this.
What Should Be Achieved:
Build creative output.
What is Gained:
• Musical awareness
• Playful AI link
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI learns from errors.
topics.Explanation:
• AI makes guesses and checks if it’s right. 
 • When wrong, it tries again differently. 
 • This is how it gets smarter.
topics.Activity 1:
Learning Loops
Materials Needed: Pencil, paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Write 3 simple math problems.
• Solve once, check, and retry mistakes.
• Talk about how retrying helps.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice learning from errors.
What is Gained:
• Growth mindset
• AI feedback logic
topics.Activity 2:
AI Retry Race
Materials Needed: Timer, puzzle.
Steps to Follow:
• Try solving puzzle in time.
• If wrong, adjust and retry faster.
What Should Be Achieved:
See how retry improves result.
What is Gained:
• Speed with reflection
• Problem-solving strategy
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To introduce how AI detects patterns.
topics.Explanation:
• AI looks at data to find regular things. 
 • Patterns help AI predict. 
 • Used in games, weather, and more.
topics.Activity 1:
Pattern Finder
Materials Needed: Beads or blocks.
Steps to Follow:
• Create color patterns with beads.
• Ask child to continue or fix broken pattern.
What Should Be Achieved:
Detect and continue patterns.
What is Gained:
• Pattern recognition
• Focused observation
topics.Activity 2:
Prediction Time
Materials Needed: List of days and temperatures.
Steps to Follow:
• Look at 5 days’ data.
• Ask what tomorrow might be.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice pattern-based thinking.
What is Gained:
• Data reading
• Logical reasoning
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI can detect emotions.
topics.Explanation:
• AI reads faces, voices, and words. 
 • It guesses if someone is happy or sad. 
 • Used in games and support bots.
topics.Activity 1:
Mood Mirror
Materials Needed: Mirror or camera.
Steps to Follow:
• Make happy, sad, surprised faces.
• Guess what AI would say.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn to link expression and emotion.
What is Gained:
• Emotional awareness
• Empathy
topics.Activity 2:
Voice Detective
Materials Needed: Recorder app.
Steps to Follow:
• Say same sentence in 3 tones.
• Guess emotion behind voice.
What Should Be Achieved:
Explore how tone shows feelings.
What is Gained:
• Listening closely
• Emotion decoding
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand step-by-step thinking.
topics.Explanation:
• AI follows rules in steps. 
 • Just like giving a robot clear orders. 
 • No guesswork, only logic.
topics.Activity 1:
Order Me!
Materials Needed: None.
Steps to Follow:
• Ask child to guide you to a chair step-by-step.
• Follow exactly.
• Show what happens with wrong steps.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn how instructions work.
What is Gained:
• Clarity in thought
• Instructional logic
topics.Activity 2:
Code My Walk
Materials Needed: Floor tiles or paper squares.
Steps to Follow:
• Make a grid path.
• Use forward/right/left commands.
What Should Be Achieved:
Follow commands to complete path.
What is Gained:
• Sequencing
• Spatial awareness
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn what a neural network is.
topics.Explanation:
• Neural networks are like a web of smart nodes. 
 • They work like tiny brains inside AI. 
 • They help AI learn.
topics.Activity 1:
Web of Thinking
Materials Needed: Yarn, pins, board.
Steps to Follow:
• Create a web with yarn across pins.
• Show how signals travel.
What Should Be Achieved:
Visualize network paths.
What is Gained:
• Concept of connectivity
• Imagination
topics.Activity 2:
Node Game
Materials Needed: Friends or family.
Steps to Follow:
• Each person is a node.
• Pass messages with decisions.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate how nodes work.
What is Gained:
• Group logic
• Neural network basics
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To imagine AI learning from history.
topics.Explanation:
• AI reads old data to understand the past. 
 • It helps predict future events. 
 • Used in studies and museums.
topics.Activity 1:
Time Capsule Scan
Materials Needed: Printed old pictures or books.
Steps to Follow:
• Explore old objects or stories.
• Guess what AI might learn.
What Should Be Achieved:
Think about data from the past.
What is Gained:
• Historical link
• AI prediction thought
topics.Activity 2:
Future Guess
Materials Needed: Notebook.
Steps to Follow:
• Based on old trends, guess future tech.
• Record and draw ideas.
What Should Be Achieved:
Predicting using data.
What is Gained:
• Creative thinking
• Logic development
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore animal behavior recognition.
topics.Explanation:
• AI watches animals to learn patterns. 
 • It tracks how they move and live. 
 • Used in wildlife protection.
topics.Activity 1:
Track the Tiger
Materials Needed: Paper, tiger footprints (printed).
Steps to Follow:
• Place footprints around home.
• Follow path like AI tracker.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand AI movement tracking.
What is Gained:
• Pattern spotting
• Animal knowledge
topics.Activity 2:
Who’s Who in the Wild
Materials Needed: Animal pictures.
Steps to Follow:
• Show different animals.
• Guess what AI might learn from them.
What Should Be Achieved:
Observe traits and behaviors.
What is Gained:
• Observation
• Biodiversity awareness
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To show how AI mimics behavior.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can watch and copy human actions. 
 • Like how kids copy adults. 
 • Used in robots and training.
topics.Activity 1:
Mirror Me
Materials Needed: None.
Steps to Follow:
• Stand in front of child.
• Do actions slowly.
• Ask child to copy exactly.
What Should Be Achieved:
Mimicry understanding.
What is Gained:
• Focus
• Body control
topics.Activity 2:
AI Copy Bot
Materials Needed: Simple task items (e.g., cup, spoon).
Steps to Follow:
• Do task once.
• Child pretends to be AI and repeats.
What Should Be Achieved:
Imitate with accuracy.
What is Gained:
• Action memory
• Step learning
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To discover how AI creates art and stories.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can draw, write, or compose music. 
 • It uses data and learns style. 
 • Combines logic with creativity.
topics.Activity 1:
AI Artist
Materials Needed: Drawing tools.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw random shapes.
• Create a story or art around it like AI might.
What Should Be Achieved:
Blend creativity with pattern.
What is Gained:
• Artistic logic
• Storytelling
topics.Activity 2:
Smart Story Builder
Materials Needed: Cards with nouns and verbs.
Steps to Follow:
• Pick 3 cards.
• Build a story like AI would.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand how AI builds with input.
What is Gained:
• Language development
• Fun AI analogy
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To begin basic coding concepts through AI.
topics.Explanation:
• AI uses code to function. 
 • Code gives it rules to follow. 
 • Kids can start learning code too.
topics.Activity 1:
Code My Robot
Materials Needed: Arrows on paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Set up a map.
• Use arrows to “code” movement to target.
What Should Be Achieved:
Basic direction coding.
What is Gained:
• Sequential logic
• Coding interest
topics.Activity 2:
Code Dance
Materials Needed: Steps written on paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Create dance steps as code.
• Perform as per written code.
What Should Be Achieved:
Code turns into action.
What is Gained:
• Fun with logic
• Physical coding experience

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI creates art, music, and stories.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can be trained to create drawings, poems, or songs.
• It uses patterns it has learned from humans.
• It doesn't feel, but it can surprise us with ideas.
topics.Activity 1:
ImagineBot
Materials Needed: Paper, colors, computer or tablet (optional).
Steps to Follow:
• Ask child to draw or write like an AI trying to imagine something new.
• Compare with a real AI-generated image or poem.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand how AI mimics human creativity.
What is Gained:
• Imagination
• Differentiation skills
topics.Activity 2:
Inspiration or Copy?
Materials Needed: Printouts of real vs AI art or stories.
Steps to Follow:
• Show examples and ask child to guess if AI or human made it.
• Discuss what clues helped them decide.
What Should Be Achieved:
Recognize AI-created content.
What is Gained:
• Critical thinking
• Pattern observation
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Topic: The AI That Learns From You
topics.Objective: To understand machine learning through feedback loops.
topics.Explanation:
• AI improves when it gets feedback.
• Just like a student, it learns from mistakes.
• You help it get smarter with your input.
topics.Activity 1:
Teach the Robot
Materials Needed: Friend or adult acting like a robot.
Steps to Follow:
• Give a task and correct mistakes as they act.
• Repeat until it’s perfect.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand how feedback trains AI.
What is Gained:
• Communication
• Learning reinforcement
topics.Activity 2:
Spot the Pattern
Materials Needed: Graph paper or printed patterns.
Steps to Follow:
• Show series of shapes, colors, or numbers.
• Ask what comes next and why.
What Should Be Achieved:
Recognize pattern-based learning.
What is Gained:
• Logical thinking
• Pattern prediction
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI stores and recalls data.
topics.Explanation:
• AI uses data to make decisions.
• It stores memory differently from humans.
• More data often means better predictions.
topics.Activity 1:
Memory Sorter
Materials Needed: Flashcards or labeled boxes.
Steps to Follow:
• Show items to “train” memory.
• Ask the child to sort or recall based on pattern.
What Should Be Achieved:
Link between memory and AI logic.
What is Gained:
• Sorting skills
• Data association
topics.Activity 2:
Data Detective
Materials Needed: Simple dataset (printed or verbal).
Steps to Follow:
• Ask questions based on the dataset.
• Let the child guess answers using past data.
What Should Be Achieved:
Use stored data to answer new questions.
What is Gained:
• Analytical skills
• Pattern recall
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Topic: Can AI Tell How You Feel?
topics.Objective: To understand how AI detects human emotions.
topics.Explanation:
• AI reads facial expressions and voice tones.
• It's used in games, customer service, and learning tools.
• It's not perfect—it guesses from clues.
topics.Activity 1:
Emoji Coder
Materials Needed: Printed emoji or drawn faces.
Steps to Follow:
• Match emotions to each face.
• Discuss how AI might guess the emotion.
What Should Be Achieved:
See how AI maps expression to feeling.
What is Gained:
• Emotional awareness
• Visual matching
topics.Activity 2:
Voice Mood Test
Materials Needed: Recorder or app.
Steps to Follow:
• Say a sentence in happy/sad/scared tone.
• Guess the emotion each time.
• Discuss how tone affects meaning.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand tone recognition.
What is Gained:
• Listening skill
• AI empathy basics
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI deciphers codes and hidden patterns.
topics.Explanation:
• AI solves puzzles in text, images, or numbers.
• It breaks patterns to understand hidden messages.
• Used in cybersecurity, science, and decoding.
topics.Activity 1:
Cipher Game
Materials Needed: Coded message sheet.
Steps to Follow:
• Replace letters using a key (e.g., A=Z).
• Try to decode short words or phrases.
What Should Be Achieved:
See how AI cracks codes.
What is Gained:
• Problem solving
• Logic building
topics.Activity 2:
Hidden Patterns
Materials Needed: Pattern puzzles or shape sheets.
Steps to Follow:
• Find what repeats, what’s missing.
• Explain how AI might find that too.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand pattern matching.
What is Gained:
• Visual learning
• Critical thinking
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI decides between options.
topics.Explanation:
• AI uses rules and data to make choices.
• It looks at what happened before.
• Like a decision tree, it picks the best option.
topics.Activity 1:
Decision Tree Game
Materials Needed: Paper, markers.
Steps to Follow:
• Create a simple yes/no flowchart.
• Use it to decide what snack to eat!
What Should Be Achieved:
Visualize AI-style decision making.
What is Gained:
• Structured thinking
• Visualization
topics.Activity 2:
Choice Analyzer
Materials Needed: List of daily decisions.
Steps to Follow:
• Discuss pros and cons of each option.
• Choose like an AI based on logic.
What Should Be Achieved:
Apply logic to everyday choices.
What is Gained:
• Decision skills
• Analytical reasoning
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Topic: AI and the Power of Words
topics.Objective: To explore how AI understands and generates language.
topics.Explanation:
• AI reads and writes based on word patterns.
• Used in translations, chatbots, and writing tools.
• Learns language from huge datasets.
topics.Activity 1:
Talk Like a Bot
Materials Needed: Common phrases written down.
Steps to Follow:
• Rearrange words like a chatbot might.
• Try giving simple AI-like replies.
What Should Be Achieved:
Feel how AI handles language.
What is Gained:
• Sentence structuring
• AI logic
topics.Activity 2:
Predict My Word
Materials Needed: Short sentence starters.
Steps to Follow:
• Ask child to guess the next word in a phrase.
• Compare with AI-generated completions.
What Should Be Achieved:
Predict language patterns.
What is Gained:
• Vocabulary
• Language modeling
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI can be fooled with wrong data.
topics.Explanation:
• AI trusts its training data too much.
• If tricked, it can make mistakes.
• This is why testing AI is important.
topics.Activity 1:
Fool the Robot
Materials Needed: Optical illusions or tricky questions.
Steps to Follow:
• Show examples where AI might fail.
• Ask why it could be confused.
What Should Be Achieved:
See AI’s limits.
What is Gained:
• Curiosity
• Critical questioning
topics.Activity 2:
Spot the Error
Materials Needed: Pictures with hidden flaws.
Steps to Follow:
• Look for odd or misplaced items.
• Discuss how AI might react.
What Should Be Achieved:
Explore bias and confusion in AI.
What is Gained:
• Observation
• Understanding AI flaws
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explain how AI uses loops to repeat tasks.
topics.Explanation:
• Loops help AI do jobs again and again.
• Saves time and increases speed.
• Used in games, robots, and software.
topics.Activity 1:
Loop Dance
Materials Needed: None.
Steps to Follow:
• Create 3 dance steps and repeat 3 times.
• Show how loops save instructions.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand repeat logic.
What is Gained:
• Memory
• Pattern rhythm
topics.Activity 2:
Code the Repeater
Materials Needed: Paper and pen.
Steps to Follow:
• Write a fake AI rule (e.g., jump 2x, turn left).
• Repeat actions using loops.
What Should Be Achieved:
Visualize loop-based behavior.
What is Gained:
• Logic
• Sequencing
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI interprets images and shapes.
topics.Explanation:
• AI “sees” using data from pixels.
• It turns images into numbers and patterns.
• Used in face recognition and object detection.
topics.Activity 1:
Shape Scanner
Materials Needed: Photos or drawn shapes.
Steps to Follow:
• Point to items and explain how AI might label them.
• Use boxes to show “detection.”
What Should Be Achieved:
See image labeling idea.
What is Gained:
• Visual reasoning
• AI vision concept
topics.Activity 2:
Pixel Puzzle
Materials Needed: Grid paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw a simple image using colored squares.
• Talk about how AI reads pixel data.
What Should Be Achieved:
Link images to numbers.
What is Gained:
• Math-art link
• Pixel understanding
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how robots use decision trees to choose actions.
topics.Explanation:
• Robots use a kind of “if this, then that” logic. 
 • This helps them choose what to do. 
 • It’s called a decision tree.
topics.Activity 1:
Decision Tree Drawing
Materials Needed: Paper, pencil.
Steps to Follow:
• Create a simple robot scenario (e.g., cleaning room).
• Draw a tree of choices: If room is dirty → clean.
• Add more “if” paths.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand how robots decide.
What is Gained:
• Logical reasoning
• Visualization
topics.Activity 2:
Choice Machine
Materials Needed: Flashcards with actions.
Steps to Follow:
• Present a situation (e.g., it’s raining).
• Pick correct response card using “if-then” logic.
• Build chains of choices.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice of AI logic.
What is Gained:
• Problem-solving
• AI flow understanding
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI tries to learn like the human brain.
topics.Explanation:
• Neural networks are made of layers that learn patterns. 
 • Each layer passes information to the next. 
 • That’s how AI recognizes things.
topics.Activity 1:
AI Layer Stack
Materials Needed: Paper, colored blocks or cups.
Steps to Follow:
• Stack blocks as input, hidden, output layers.
• Pass a message through each.
• Each layer “transforms” it.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand layers in networks.
What is Gained:
• Layered thinking
• AI model basics
topics.Activity 2:
Pattern Teacher
Materials Needed: Pattern cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Show patterns to child.
• Let them “train” a pretend AI to recognize it.
• Add variations over time.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulation of AI learning.
What is Gained:
• Pattern recognition
• Concept of training data
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI remembers important details.
topics.Explanation:
• AI has something like memory, called weights. 
 • It helps AI “remember” what is important. 
 • These are adjusted as AI learns.
topics.Activity 1:
Memory Match AI-Style
Materials Needed: Picture cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Play memory match, but assign “weights” to each card.
• Try to guess which will be remembered more.
What Should Be Achieved:
Feel how AI gives priority.
What is Gained:
• AI learning logic
• Memory game with a twist
topics.Activity 2:
Weighted Choices
Materials Needed: Marbles, jars.
Steps to Follow:
• Assign different “importance” to jars.
• Drop marbles based on what’s most important.
• Adjust as you go.
What Should Be Achieved:
See how AI adjusts weights.
What is Gained:
• Concept of importance
• Dynamic thinking
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand the role of feedback in AI learning.
topics.Explanation:
• AI gets better by checking mistakes. 
 • Feedback tells it if it was right or wrong. 
 • This helps AI improve.
topics.Activity 1:
Yes-No Trainer
Materials Needed: Question cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Play teacher-student: AI guesses, child gives feedback.
• Use yes/no until AI gets better.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand learning by correction.
What is Gained:
• Iterative learning
• Correction logic
topics.Activity 2:
AI Draws Again
Materials Needed: Paper, crayons.
Steps to Follow:
• AI (you) draws something.
• Child gives clues to improve it.
• Repeat until it’s accurate.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate training with feedback.
What is Gained:
• Creative logic
• Process improvement
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI understands speech and sounds.
topics.Explanation:
• AI hears using microphones. 
 • It breaks sound into pieces. 
 • Then it learns what words mean.
topics.Activity 1:
Sound Splitter
Materials Needed: Audio clips.
Steps to Follow:
• Listen to different sounds.
• Break them into short “chunks.”
• Guess what each part might mean.
What Should Be Achieved:
Recognize how AI breaks down sound.
What is Gained:
• Audio analysis
• Word processing
topics.Activity 2:
Voice Guess Game
Materials Needed: Blindfold.
Steps to Follow:
• Speak a sentence in different tones.
• Child guesses meaning or feeling.
• AI does the same with sound.
What Should Be Achieved:
Explore how voice is understood.
What is Gained:
• Tone awareness
• Speech interpretation
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn that AI makes mistakes and how it learns from them.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can give wrong answers. 
 • Mistakes help AI improve. 
 • Like humans, it learns over time.
topics.Activity 1:
Spot the Error
Materials Needed: Flashcards with right/wrong answers.
Steps to Follow:
• Show cards, ask child to guess which is AI’s wrong answer.
• Discuss why it might have made that mistake.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand fallibility in AI.
What is Gained:
• Error awareness
• Thinking beyond output
topics.Activity 2:
Correct the Robot
Materials Needed: Toy robot, command cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Give robot incorrect instructions on purpose.
• Let child fix the steps.
• Repeat with variations.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn from AI’s trial and error.
What is Gained:
• Debugging thinking
• Problem-solving
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand what makes an AI assistant useful.
topics.Explanation:
• AI helpers answer questions or do tasks. 
 • They learn from use. 
 • Good helpers are trained well.
topics.Activity 1:
Design an Assistant
Materials Needed: Paper, markers.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw a pretend smart assistant.
• List what it should know and do.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand features of useful AI.
What is Gained:
• Creative planning
• Task mapping
topics.Activity 2:
Command Game
Materials Needed: Timer.
Steps to Follow:
• Take turns being the AI.
• Follow short voice commands quickly.
• Improve speed and accuracy.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate smart assistant behavior.
What is Gained:
• Listening skill
• AI task awareness
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI detects emotions in speech.
topics.Explanation:
• AI listens to voice tones. 
 • It can tell happy, sad, angry. 
 • This is called emotion recognition.
topics.Activity 1:
Feel the Voice
Materials Needed: Emotion cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Read sentences in different tones.
• Child matches to correct emotion card.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand tone-based emotion.
What is Gained:
• Empathy
• Sound analysis
topics.Activity 2:
Emotion Spotting
Materials Needed: Audio clips.
Steps to Follow:
• Listen to short clips.
• Guess the emotion being expressed.
• Discuss how AI would guess.
What Should Be Achieved:
Emotion recognition practice.
What is Gained:
• Sensory focus
• AI empathy model
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI creates text based on training.
topics.Explanation:
• AI reads lots of text to learn. 
 • Then it writes based on patterns. 
 • It's like creative copying.
topics.Activity 1:
AI Story Chain
Materials Needed: Paper, pen.
Steps to Follow:
• Start a story.
• Let child write next line.
• Alternate like AI prediction.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice how AI predicts text.
What is Gained:
• Storytelling
• Language flow
topics.Activity 2:
Predict the Next Line
Materials Needed: Short story printouts.
Steps to Follow:
• Hide the last line.
• Let child guess what comes next.
• Reveal AI’s version after.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand text generation.
What is Gained:
• Language intuition
• Comparative learning
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI creates original-looking artwork.
topics.Explanation:
• AI is trained on images and styles. 
 • It creates new images by mixing them. 
 • This is called generative AI.
topics.Activity 1:
Style Mixer
Materials Needed: Art samples, paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Show two styles of art.
• Mix styles in a new drawing.
• Pretend to be an AI generator.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate AI creativity.
What is Gained:
• Artistic blend
• AI concept of mixing
topics.Activity 2:
AI Draws Too
Materials Needed: AI art tool or samples.
Steps to Follow:
• Compare AI-made art with child's.
• Discuss how both are creative.
What Should Be Achieved:
Respect AI creativity.
What is Gained:
• Art appreciation
• Generative thinking
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI improves itself through learning.
topics.Explanation:
• Some AI learns from mistakes and gets better. 
 • It tries again and again to improve. 
 • This is called machine learning.
topics.Activity 1:
Learning Maze
Materials Needed: Printed maze, pencil.
Steps to Follow:
• Try solving the maze.
• Mark the wrong paths.
• Try again using the new path.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand trial and error.
What is Gained:
• Persistence
• Pattern correction
topics.Activity 2:
AI Mistake Fixer
Materials Needed: List of simple math or logic errors.
Steps to Follow:
• Pretend to be an AI fixing mistakes.
• Find and fix each one.
What Should Be Achieved:
Self-correction through learning.
What is Gained:
• Attention to detail
• Growth mindset
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI processes human language.
topics.Explanation:
• Some AI understands and talks with people. 
 • This is called natural language processing. 
 • It helps AI answer questions and chat.
topics.Activity 1:
Chatbot Roleplay
Materials Needed: Pre-written chatbot prompts.
Steps to Follow:
• Take turns being a chatbot.
• Use simple, clear answers.
• Switch roles.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice how chatbots work.
What is Gained:
• Communication clarity
• Understanding responses
topics.Activity 2:
Fix the Message
Materials Needed: Sentences with jumbled or missing words.
Steps to Follow:
• Rearrange or complete the messages.
• Think like a chatbot fixing inputs.
What Should Be Achieved:
Language repair skills.
What is Gained:
• Sentence structure
• Meaning detection
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To see how AI understands photos and videos.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can look at pictures and tell what’s inside. 
 • It sees faces, animals, or even emotions. 
 • This is called image recognition.
topics.Activity 1:
Guess the Scene
Materials Needed: Random pictures from magazines or books.
Steps to Follow:
• Child describes what’s in each picture.
• Discuss how AI might describe the same.
What Should Be Achieved:
Compare human and AI observation.
What is Gained:
• Visual detail
• AI interpretation
topics.Activity 2:
Build-a-Scene
Materials Needed: Drawing paper, crayons.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw a scene with lots of details.
• Have a friend guess what AI might say.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate AI tagging images.
What is Gained:
• Creativity
• Imaginative logic
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI reads emotions.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can read faces to tell feelings. 
 • This is called emotion detection. 
 • It’s used in games, cars, and education.
topics.Activity 1:
Face Mood Mirror
Materials Needed: Mirror.
Steps to Follow:
• Make a happy face, sad face, etc.
• Describe each one.
• Imagine how AI would read it.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand expressions.
What is Gained:
• Self-awareness
• Facial recognition
topics.Activity 2:
Emotion Match
Materials Needed: Cards with emoji faces.
Steps to Follow:
• Match emoji with real expressions.
• Discuss how AI links them.
What Should Be Achieved:
Match feelings to visuals.
What is Gained:
• Empathy
• Emotion logic
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn about how AI follows instructions.
topics.Explanation:
• AI uses code to act and decide. 
 • It follows logic like “if this, then that.” 
 • Simple rules can create smart actions.
topics.Activity 1:
Code Me!
Materials Needed: None.
Steps to Follow:
• Give child commands like a robot: “If I clap, spin.”
• Add more “if-then” steps.
What Should Be Achieved:
Experience AI decision rules.
What is Gained:
• Logic following
• Cause-effect link
topics.Activity 2:
Make-A-Code
Materials Needed: Pencil and paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Write 3 simple “if-then” rules.
• Test them on someone else.
What Should Be Achieved:
Write logic-based actions.
What is Gained:
• Rule design
• Logical creativity
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand neural networks.
topics.Explanation:
• AI has “brains” made of nodes. 
 • These connect like a web. 
 • Together, they make decisions.
topics.Activity 1:
Node Web Game
Materials Needed: String, paper circles.
Steps to Follow:
• Label circles as inputs and outputs.
• Connect with string to show network.
What Should Be Achieved:
Visualize AI thinking.
What is Gained:
• Conceptual modeling
• System awareness
topics.Activity 2:
Puzzle Decision
Materials Needed: Puzzle with many options.
Steps to Follow:
• Choose paths by linking ideas.
• Mimic how AI narrows choices.
What Should Be Achieved:
Experience layered decisions.
What is Gained:
• Decision-making
• Pattern tracing
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore AI’s decision speed.
topics.Explanation:
• AI checks tons of choices quickly. 
 • It uses data to pick the best one. 
 • Speed helps in games, driving, and safety.
topics.Activity 1:
Quick Think Race
Materials Needed: Timer, questions.
Steps to Follow:
• Ask fast questions like “Which is taller?”
• Child answers in 3 seconds.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate fast AI choices.
What is Gained:
• Speed thinking
• Confidence
topics.Activity 2:
Data Sorter
Materials Needed: Paper slips with info.
Steps to Follow:
• Sort items into yes/no piles.
• Add time pressure.
What Should Be Achieved:
Quick data handling.
What is Gained:
• Sorting
• Focused filtering
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI remembers patterns.
topics.Explanation:
• AI remembers what it sees often. 
 • This helps it predict or suggest things. 
 • Like remembering your favorites.
topics.Activity 1:
Repeat Finder
Materials Needed: Card deck or shape tiles.
Steps to Follow:
• Show patterns, then hide.
• Ask what repeats.
What Should Be Achieved:
Pattern memory.
What is Gained:
• Observation
• Recall
topics.Activity 2:
Suggestion Bot
Materials Needed: List of past choices.
Steps to Follow:
• Pick favorite colors, foods, etc.
• Suggest new things based on past.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate recommendation AI.
What is Gained:
• Personalization
• Logical prediction
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To connect AI to real-world adventures.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can be part of solving problems. 
 • Think of it as a teammate in a story. 
 • Encourages imagination and logic.
topics.Activity 1:
Hero and AI
Materials Needed: Paper and pencil.
Steps to Follow:
• Write a short story where AI helps a hero.
• Act it out.
What Should Be Achieved:
Story integration of AI.
What is Gained:
• Creativity
• Tech awareness
topics.Activity 2:
Choose Your AI
Materials Needed: Character cards with AI roles.
Steps to Follow:
• Pick an AI to help in a problem.
• Explain the choice.
What Should Be Achieved:
Role linking.
What is Gained:
• Justification
• Role-play logic
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To think about ethics and choices in AI.
topics.Explanation:
• Should AI make all choices? 
 • Who decides what is right? 
 • Talk about fairness and responsibility.
topics.Activity 1:
AI Choice Debate
Materials Needed: Sample situations.
Steps to Follow:
• Read a situation.
• Ask: should AI decide or humans?
• Discuss reasons.
What Should Be Achieved:
Reflect on AI power.
What is Gained:
• Ethics thinking
• Moral reasoning
topics.Activity 2:
Build a Fair Bot
Materials Needed: Drawing paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw a fair AI character.
• List its rules.
What Should Be Achieved:
Think of fairness in AI.
What is Gained:
• Design thinking
• Responsibility sense
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI predicts future actions.
topics.Explanation:
• AI uses past data to guess what might happen. 
 • It helps in things like weather and traffic. 
 • The more it learns, the better it predicts.
topics.Activity 1:
Pattern Prophet
Materials Needed: Colored blocks or coins.
Steps to Follow:
• Make a pattern like red-red-blue.
• Hide the last one and ask child to predict it.
• Add more complex patterns.
What Should Be Achieved:
Predict patterns like AI.
What is Gained:
• Analytical thinking
• Pattern recognition
topics.Activity 2:
Future Forecast
Materials Needed: Simple weather chart.
Steps to Follow:
• Show past 3 days of weather.
• Ask child to guess tomorrow’s weather.
• Discuss how AI uses more data.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand AI prediction basics.
What is Gained:
• Logical thinking
• Concept of datasets
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how machines try to "think" like humans.
topics.Explanation:
• AI mimics the brain using artificial neurons. 
 • It makes decisions and solves problems. 
 • It's called a neural network.
topics.Activity 1:
Neural Path Maze
Materials Needed: Paper maze or printed brain path.
Steps to Follow:
• Let child trace a decision path.
• Add options and outcomes at each fork.
• Show how AI chooses based on past.
What Should Be Achieved:
Explore decision-making logic.
What is Gained:
• Strategic planning
• Intro to AI networks
topics.Activity 2:
Memory Builder
Materials Needed: Sequence cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Show a pattern of 5 cards.
• Ask child to recall or guess next.
• Talk about how AI uses "memory."
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulate data memory.
What is Gained:
• Memory strengthening
• AI-style learning
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To show how AI mimics human senses.
topics.Explanation:
• AI can see, hear, touch, smell, and taste in different ways. 
 • It uses sensors and data to sense like humans. 
 • Not perfect, but improving.
topics.Activity 1:
Sound Sorter
Materials Needed: Audio clips or phone.
Steps to Follow:
• Play different animal or object sounds.
• Ask child to name and sort them.
• Talk about AI voice recognition.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand AI listening.
What is Gained:
• Sound discrimination
• Sensory connection
topics.Activity 2:
Taste Test AI
Materials Needed: Variety of snacks.
Steps to Follow:
• Blindfold child and ask them to guess taste.
• Talk about how AI might "sense" flavor.
• Compare accuracy.
What Should Be Achieved:
Awareness of taste recognition.
What is Gained:
• Sensory engagement
• AI vs human comparison
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI learns from mistakes.
topics.Explanation:
• AI makes mistakes, then adjusts. 
 • It needs feedback to improve. 
 • This is called training.
topics.Activity 1:
Spot the Glitch
Materials Needed: Printed patterns with errors.
Steps to Follow:
• Show AI-designed patterns with a flaw.
• Ask child to find and correct them.
• Discuss how AI is corrected.
What Should Be Achieved:
Spotting AI errors.
What is Gained:
• Attention to detail
• Feedback concepts
topics.Activity 2:
Fix the Robot
Materials Needed: Toy robot or pretend setup.
Steps to Follow:
• Make the robot do a wrong action.
• Ask child to suggest a fix.
• Try again.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn from errors.
What is Gained:
• Problem-solving
• Learning process
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore how AI reads feelings.
topics.Explanation:
• AI uses face, voice, and words to guess emotion. 
 • Not always accurate. 
 • Helps in games and care.
topics.Activity 1:
Guess That Mood
Materials Needed: Emotion flashcards.
Steps to Follow:
• Show a card and ask child to mimic it.
• Talk about how AI might read this.
• Discuss challenges.
What Should Be Achieved:
Explore expression recognition.
What is Gained:
• Emotional intelligence
• Empathy
topics.Activity 2:
Feeling Sort
Materials Needed: List of emojis or words.
Steps to Follow:
• Group by happy, sad, angry, etc.
• Compare how AI might label them.
• Talk about mistakes AI can make.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understanding AI emotion tags.
What is Gained:
• Vocabulary
• AI limitations
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how AI solves puzzles and games.
topics.Explanation:
• AI plays games by using rules and patterns. 
 • It keeps trying until it wins. 
 • This is a way of learning.
topics.Activity 1:
Bot Puzzle Master
Materials Needed: Puzzle board or Sudoku sheet.
Steps to Follow:
• Start puzzle, give AI-style hints.
• Use if-then steps.
• Discuss how bots do it faster.
What Should Be Achieved:
AI approach to solving.
What is Gained:
• Reasoning
• Step-by-step thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Try-Fail-Win
Materials Needed: Maze or logic puzzle.
Steps to Follow:
• Attempt different paths.
• Mark fails, retry better.
• Note what was learned.
What Should Be Achieved:
Trial-and-error method.
What is Gained:
• Persistence
• AI learning flow
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To show how AI makes and learns music.
topics.Explanation:
• AI listens and creates music. 
 • It can remix or write new songs. 
 • It learns from many samples.
topics.Activity 1:
Rhythm AI
Materials Needed: Drum or tapping surface.
Steps to Follow:
• Tap out a beat.
• Ask child to predict next rhythm.
• Talk about AI pattern learning.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand rhythmic prediction.
What is Gained:
• Listening skill
• Music pattern sense
topics.Activity 2:
Compose Me!
Materials Needed: Simple music app.
Steps to Follow:
• Let child add sounds and create tune.
• Add “AI suggestions” like faster/slower.
• Compare versions.
What Should Be Achieved:
Music creation experience.
What is Gained:
• Creativity
• Music-AI link
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To explore voice recognition by AI.
topics.Explanation:
• AI hears and knows who is speaking. 
 • Each voice has a unique print. 
 • It helps with security and assistants.
topics.Activity 1:
Voice Match
Materials Needed: Recordings from family members.
Steps to Follow:
• Play clips and guess the speaker.
• Compare with AI voice tech.
• Discuss voice prints.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand voice identity.
What is Gained:
• Auditory memory
• Tech appreciation
topics.Activity 2:
Say the Secret
Materials Needed: Password phrase.
Steps to Follow:
• Child says phrase in different voices.
• Talk about voice unlocking.
• Try saying it wrong.
What Should Be Achieved:
Voice verification concept.
What is Gained:
• Curiosity
• Cyber awareness
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To understand how AI sees and detects.
topics.Explanation:
• AI uses cameras to detect faces, shapes, or colors. 
 • It’s used in phones, cars, and more. 
 • Called computer vision.
topics.Activity 1:
Object Finder
Materials Needed: Set of mixed items.
Steps to Follow:
• Show picture of item.
• Ask child to find matching object.
• Mimic how AI scans for matches.
What Should Be Achieved:
Visual matching concept.
What is Gained:
• Fast recognition
• Search skills
topics.Activity 2:
Color Coder
Materials Needed: Colored paper or blocks.
Steps to Follow:
• Give sorting challenge by color.
• Add twist like sort only red & green.
• Show how AI filters by input.
What Should Be Achieved:
Color filtering idea.
What is Gained:
• Sorting logic
• Focus skill
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To learn how humans train AI.
topics.Explanation:
• AI learns from examples we give. 
 • Good data = smart AI. 
 • Bad data = confused AI.
topics.Activity 1:
Right or Wrong
Materials Needed: Picture cards (right/wrong).
Steps to Follow:
• Show cat picture and say “cat.”
• Show dog and say “cat” (wrong).
• Ask child what AI would learn.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn about input accuracy.
What is Gained:
• Cause-effect link
• Teaching mindset
topics.Activity 2:
Feed the Bot
Materials Needed: Toy with open mouth or bin.
Steps to Follow:
• Give toy good items (food), then bad (trash).
• Discuss what it should learn.
• Compare results.
What Should Be Achieved:
See impact of data quality.
What is Gained:
• Understanding training
• Quality importance
topics.path_description: AI and technology skills progression

topics.Objective: To introduce the idea of selling and buying.
topics.Explanation:
• Shops are places where people buy things. 
 • Shopkeepers help us choose and pay. 
 • Some kids also pretend to run shops.
topics.Activity 1:
Toy Shop Setup
Materials Needed: Toy fruits, boxes, play money.
Steps to Follow:
• Set up a pretend shop with toys.
• Child plays as shopkeeper, you play as buyer.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand role of a shopkeeper.
What is Gained:
• Role play
• Early business idea
topics.Activity 2:
Price Match Game
Materials Needed: Flashcards with items and prices.
Steps to Follow:
• Show item card and ask child to match with correct price.
• Use simple numbers.
What Should Be Achieved:
Connect value with items.
What is Gained:
• Number sense
• Item-value link
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To understand making and selling something.
topics.Explanation:
• People can make things and sell them. 
 • Lemonade is a simple thing kids can pretend to sell. 
 • Selling teaches sharing and helping.

Pretend Lemonade Stand

Steps to Follow:
• Child sets up a lemonade stand with pretend items.
• Invite family to “buy.”
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand selling idea.
What is Gained:
• Creativity
• Social play
topics.Activity 2:
Decorate & Advertise
Materials Needed: Crayons, signs, stickers.
Steps to Follow:
• Make signs to attract customers.
• Decorate stand with fun stickers.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn simple promotion.
What is Gained:
• Art skill
• Early marketing
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To learn about money used in business.
topics.Explanation:
• Coins are used to buy and sell. 
 • Different coins have different values. 
 • Entrepreneurs need to understand money.

Coin Sorting

Steps to Follow:
• Sort coins by size or color.
• Talk about how coins are used to buy.
What Should Be Achieved:
Recognize money types.
What is Gained:
• Sorting skills
• Money awareness
topics.Activity 2:
Coin Store Game
Materials Needed: Coins, small toys.
Steps to Follow:
• Set price for each toy.
• Child “buys” with coins.
What Should Be Achieved:
Use money in pretend buying.
What is Gained:
• Counting
• Decision-making
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To introduce the idea of building a small market.
topics.Explanation:
• Markets are places with many small sellers. 
 • Each box can be a shop with items.

Market Setup
Materials Needed: Cardboard boxes, toys, cloth pieces.
Steps to Follow:
• Set up different box stalls.
• Each stall has something to “sell.”
What Should Be Achieved:
Build small market stalls.
What is Gained:
• Imagination
• Sorting and setup
topics.Activity 2:
Market Walk
Materials Needed: Paper bag or basket.
Steps to Follow:
• Child walks around choosing items.
• Practice saying “How much?” or “Thank you.”
What Should Be Achieved:
Role-play buying in a market.
What is Gained:
• Speaking skills
• Social behavior
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• People trade when they don’t use money. 
 • You give something and get something back. 
 • Fair trade helps everyone.

Toy Swap

Steps to Follow:
• Offer one toy and ask for a trade.
• Talk about why the trade is fair.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand equal value.
What is Gained:
• Fairness
• Decision making
topics.Activity 2:
Snack Trade
Materials Needed: Two kinds of snacks.
Steps to Follow:
• Trade snack types with each other.
• Discuss if both are happy with it.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practice real trade.
What is Gained:
• Sharing
• Negotiation

topics.Explanation:

What's Your Idea?

• Write or draw ideas and put in the box.

Think creatively about business.
What is Gained:
• Idea generation
• Confidence
topics.Activity 2:
Pick & Act

Steps to Follow:
• Pick a slip and act it out.
• Pretend to make or sell the idea.
What Should Be Achieved:
Connect idea to action.
What is Gained:
• Expression
• Imagination
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Customers are people who buy. 
 • Good sellers listen and help. 
 • Happy customers return.

Be a Helpful Seller

• Child pretends to sell.
• You ask for help and smile if they help.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn polite seller behavior.
What is Gained:
• Social skills
• Empathy
topics.Activity 2:
Happy Shopper

Steps to Follow:
• Give a sticker if child is polite while selling.
• Celebrate good service.
What Should Be Achieved:
Encourage care in selling.
What is Gained:
• Reward motivation
• Manners
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Not all entrepreneurs sell things—some build or help. 
 • Services include cleaning, fixing, or teaching. 
 • Helping others is a kind of work too.

Fix-It Pretend

• Pretend to fix the broken toy.
• Act like a builder or fixer.

Understand service as business.
What is Gained:

Helper Badge

Steps to Follow:
• Give a badge when child helps fix or clean.
• Pretend they earned it like a helper.
What Should Be Achieved:
Value of small services.
What is Gained:
• Responsibility
• Self-worth
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To recognize money as something people use.
topics.Explanation:
• Money can be coins or paper. 
 • Some money looks different in color and size.

Make Play Money

Create pretend money.

Use It to Buy

• Use created money to buy toys in pretend play.

What Should Be Achieved:
Link money to buying.
What is Gained:
• Math start
• Business logic
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Ads help people know what’s for sale. 
 • You can draw, talk, or act to advertise.

Understand basic promotion.
What is Gained:
• Art expression

topics.Activity 2:
Talk Show Seller

• Pretend you’re on TV selling the product.
• Say why it’s great and useful.

• A lemonade stand is a tiny business.

topics.Activity 2:
Sell Me Something

• Choose a toy to “sell.”

Practice persuasion.

• Communication
• Confidence

topics.Explanation:
• Entrepreneurs save money to use later.

Picture Your Goal

Steps to Follow:
• Draw what you want to save for.
• Place it on or near the jar.

Connect saving to goals.
What is Gained:
• Motivation
• Visual thinking

topics.Explanation:

What Can This Be?

Creative product thinking.

topics.Activity 2:
Pretend Product Pitch
Materials Needed: Toy microphone or cardboard tube.
Steps to Follow:
• Pretend to “sell” the created item.
• Talk about what it does.
• Use imagination.

Share ideas clearly.
What is Gained:
• Confidence
• Public speaking

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Some businesses also help people. 
 • Giving and kindness are part of good entrepreneurship. 
 • You can “sell” for free!
topics.Activity 1:
Gift Shop Roleplay

• Set up a pretend shop.

Value of giving.

Thank You Cards

Practice appreciation.
What is Gained:

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To introduce the idea of planning before doing.
topics.Explanation:
• Entrepreneurs make a plan before they start. 
 • Planning saves time and effort. 
 • Even play needs a plan!
topics.Activity 1:
Build-a-Plan
Materials Needed: Blocks or LEGO.
Steps to Follow:
• Before building, draw what you want to make.
• Then build it with blocks.
• Compare plan vs. real build.

Plan before action.
What is Gained:
• Thinking ahead
• Organization
topics.Activity 2:
My Business Map
Materials Needed: Paper, markers.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw a simple shop or service idea.
Steps to Follow: • Mark setup, talk, sell.
• Walk through the steps.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand business steps.
What is Gained:
• Process thinking
• Clarity
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Entrepreneurs explain ideas clearly. 
 • Speaking helps sell, lead, and share. 
 • Practice helps children speak with power.

Toy Talk

Steps to Follow:
• Ask child to introduce the toy as if it’s a new product.

Speaking for a purpose.

• Confidence
• Persuasive skills
topics.Activity 2:
Mirror Speech

Steps to Follow:
• Child speaks in front of mirror.
• Give a simple “business pitch.”
• Smile, stand tall, and speak slow.

Body language awareness.
What is Gained:
• Public speaking
• Expression control

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:

Price Tag Game

• Assign play prices to toys.

Guess the Price

• Show item and ask child to guess price.
• Say the real price.
• Talk about what makes things expensive or cheap.

Relate worth to cost.
What is Gained:
• Estimation
• Real-world awareness

• Cooperation

Role Play Market

• Switch roles.

• Flexibility
• Understanding variety

• This is how businesses begin.
topics.Activity 1:

Understanding idea development.
What is Gained:

• Business flow insight
topics.Activity 2:
Product Parade

Steps to Follow:

• Share how it was made and sold.

What is Gained:
• Presentation skills
• Entrepreneurial process
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To show how failures help in business.
topics.Explanation:
• Not all ideas work the first time. 
• Entrepreneurs try, fail, and improve. 
• Failing teaches what to fix.
topics.Activity 1:
Oops Fixer Game
Materials Needed: Building blocks.
Steps to Follow:
• Build a tall tower.
• When it falls, change the design.
• Try again until it stands strong.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learning from trial and error.
What is Gained:
• Patience
• Problem-solving
topics.Activity 2:
Fail Story Sharing
Materials Needed: Personal example or story.
Steps to Follow:
• Share a time when you made a mistake.
• Say what you learned.
• Talk about what you’d do next time.
What Should Be Achieved:
Accepting and learning from failure.
What is Gained:
• Reflection
• Confidence
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To explore how businesses create identity.
topics.Explanation:
• Branding includes logos, colors, and names. 
• Good branding makes people remember. 
• It builds trust and interest.
topics.Activity 1:
My Brand Board
Materials Needed: Chart paper, markers.
Steps to Follow:
• Think of a product.
• Make a logo, pick colors, write a slogan.
• Display as a board.
What Should Be Achieved:
Create a brand identity.
What is Gained:
• Visual storytelling
• Marketing skills
topics.Activity 2:
Brand Swap
Materials Needed: Known brand logos.

• Cover the brand name.
• Guess the brand by color and style.
• Talk about what makes it memorable.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understanding brand recognition.
What is Gained:
• Brand awareness
• Observation

topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

• You must say what, why, and how. 
• Great pitches make people listen.

One Minute Hero

Steps to Follow:
• Pick a toy or idea.
• Try to sell it in 1 minute.
• Include why it’s great.

Clear and fast communication.
What is Gained:
• Public speaking
• Idea shaping
topics.Activity 2:
Fast Feedback
Materials Needed: Paper, pencil.
Steps to Follow:

• Make pitch better and retry.
What Should Be Achieved:
Refining ideas through feedback.
What is Gained:
• Self-evaluation
• Growth mindset
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Businesses change over time. 
• Technology changes what people sell. 
• Looking back teaches us to look ahead.

Then and Now Match

Steps to Follow:
• Match old business tools to new ones.
• Discuss what changed and why.

Understanding evolution of business.

• Business awareness
topics.Activity 2:
Future Biz Draw

• Draw a business of the future.

Creative business thinking.

topics.Explanation:

Flow the Dough

Visualizing money flow.

Money Route Map

What Should Be Achieved:
Understanding expenses and profits.
What is Gained:

• Resource thinking
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To learn how to build a simple pitch deck.
topics.Explanation:

• Make 3 slides: idea, plan, help needed.
• Draw pictures instead of using words.

Storytelling through visuals.
What is Gained:
• Planning
• Communication
topics.Activity 2:
Mini Stage Pitch

Steps to Follow:
• Present your pitch to 2–3 people.
• Ask for comments.
What Should Be Achieved:
Expressing and defending an idea.
What is Gained:
• Confidence
• Persuasion

difficulty_info.description: Building on basics with practical applications

topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

Budget Box

Learning to manage money.

Savings Plan Sketch

• Draw something to save up for.
• Add steps to reach that goal.

Visual goal tracking.

• Discipline
• Motivation
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Stories make ads more interesting. 
 • People connect with emotions and memories. 
 • Entrepreneurs use this to build trust.
topics.Activity 1:
Story Maker Ad

Steps to Follow:
• Think of a simple product (like a pencil).
• Write a short story about someone who used it.

Storytelling with a product.
What is Gained:
• Creative writing
• Emotional marketing
topics.Activity 2:
Picture Pitch
Materials Needed: Magazines, scissors, glue.
Steps to Follow:
• Cut images that match a product story.
• Create a poster ad with a story flow.
What Should Be Achieved:
Visual storytelling.
What is Gained:
• Design thinking
• Expression skills
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• A personal brand shows who you are. 
 • Entrepreneurs use their style, values, and ideas. 
 • It helps people remember them.

Brand Logo

• Design a logo that represents you.
• Use symbols or initials.
What Should Be Achieved:
Express identity with visuals.

• Self-awareness
• Design creativity

Identity Web

• Write your name in the center.

Visualize personal brand traits.
What is Gained:
• Self-reflection
• Goal setting

topics.Explanation:
• Trends are what people like or follow. 
 • Entrepreneurs notice patterns early. 
 • They create products people want.

Spot the Trend

Steps to Follow:
• Look for 3 things that are popular now.
• Discuss why people like them.
What Should Be Achieved:
Identify current trends.
What is Gained:
• Observation
• Analytical thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Create Your Trend

Steps to Follow:
• Design a trendy item (like a cap or shoes).
• Present why it could become popular.
What Should Be Achieved:
Predict a trend.
What is Gained:
• Imagination
• Market insight
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To practice short and strong product pitches.
topics.Explanation:
• An elevator pitch is a quick idea talk. 
 • It must be clear and catchy. 
 • Entrepreneurs use it to attract attention.
topics.Activity 1:
One-Minute Hero
Materials Needed: Timer.
Steps to Follow:
• Think of a business idea.
• Practice explaining it in 60 seconds.
What Should Be Achieved:
Craft a clear pitch.
What is Gained:
• Verbal clarity
• Time focus
topics.Activity 2:
Pitch Swap
Materials Needed: Paper slips with random products.
Steps to Follow:
• Pick a product slip.
• Make up a fast pitch and present.
What Should Be Achieved:
Improvise under time.
What is Gained:
• Public speaking
• Confidence
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To understand how businesses plan and sell.
topics.Explanation:
• Shops need a theme and layout. 
 • Entrepreneurs plan what to sell and how. 
 • It teaches space and sales planning.
topics.Activity 1:
Paper Shop Plan
Materials Needed: Graph paper, ruler.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw a layout for a shop (candy, toys, etc).
• Label each section with items.
What Should Be Achieved:
Design store layout.
What is Gained:
• Spatial planning
• Product awareness
topics.Activity 2:
Shop Simulation
Materials Needed: Toy items or real items.
Steps to Follow:
• Set up a mini-shop at home.
• Invite others to “shop” and role-play.
What Should Be Achieved:
Experience business flow.
What is Gained:
• Business logic
• Social interaction
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To introduce recurring business models.
topics.Explanation:
• Subscriptions bring money regularly. 
 • Think magazines, apps, or snacks. 
 • Entrepreneurs love repeat customers.
topics.Activity 1:
Create-a-Box
Materials Needed: Box, small items.
Steps to Follow:
• Make a pretend monthly box (e.g., toys, snacks).
• Choose a theme.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand box subscription idea.
What is Gained:
• Curating skills
• Value thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Monthly Surprise
Materials Needed: Paper, crayons.
Steps to Follow:
• Design 3 surprise items for each month.
• Present how each brings joy.
What Should Be Achieved:
Recurring fun planning.
What is Gained:
• Planning
• Customer view
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To learn about setting product prices.
topics.Explanation:
• Price affects how people buy. 
 • Too high? They skip. Too low? No profit. 
 • Entrepreneurs balance cost and value.
topics.Activity 1:
Price It Right
Materials Needed: Toy items, stickers.
Steps to Follow:
• Put pretend prices on items.
• Explain why each is priced that way.
What Should Be Achieved:
Learn price reasoning.
What is Gained:
• Money sense
• Decision making
topics.Activity 2:
Buyer Talk
Materials Needed: Coins or play money.
Steps to Follow:
• Act as buyer and seller.
• Try changing prices and negotiating.
What Should Be Achieved:
Test pricing strategies.
What is Gained:
• Negotiation
• Logic
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To understand how simple versions are tested.
topics.Explanation:
• MVP means minimum viable product. 
 • Test before building fully. 
 • Saves money and learns fast.
topics.Activity 1:
Make It Mini
Materials Needed: Paper, sketch pens.
Steps to Follow:
• Draw a basic idea of your product.
• Show others and get feedback.
What Should Be Achieved:
Build MVP sketch.
What is Gained:
• Early feedback
• Product thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Fix the Flaws
Materials Needed: Feedback notes.
Steps to Follow:
• Based on feedback, change your sketch.
• Improve parts that didn’t work.
What Should Be Achieved:
Improve based on testing.
What is Gained:
• Iteration
• Listening
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To know what makes a product valuable.
topics.Explanation:
• Value comes from usefulness, beauty, or rarity. 
 • Entrepreneurs add value to stand out. 
 • It’s not just cost—it’s meaning.
topics.Activity 1:
Compare and Value
Materials Needed: Two different toys.
Steps to Follow:
• Discuss why one may be worth more.
• Is it better quality? Useful? Rare?
What Should Be Achieved:
Understand value factors.
What is Gained:
• Critical thinking
• Product analysis
topics.Activity 2:
Add the Wow
Materials Needed: Any plain item.
Steps to Follow:
• Modify or decorate it to add value.
• Show how the item is now better.
What Should Be Achieved:
Add perceived value.
What is Gained:
• Creativity
• Enhancement mindset
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To understand how failure helps in business.
topics.Explanation:
• Failing fast means learning early. 
 • Entrepreneurs test, fail, fix. 
 • Mistakes are steps to success.
topics.Activity 1:
Oops to Fix
Materials Needed: Building blocks.
Steps to Follow:
• Build a tall tower that may fall.
• If it fails, rebuild better.
What Should Be Achieved:
Accept failure and retry.
What is Gained:
• Resilience
• Strategy thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Share a Fail Tale
Materials Needed: Notebook.
Steps to Follow:
• Write about a time something didn’t work.
• Reflect on what you learned.
What Should Be Achieved:
Normalize failure.
What is Gained:
• Emotional growth
• Learning attitude
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To learn how to present ideas quickly and clearly.
topics.Explanation:
• Entrepreneurs often have just a minute to explain their idea. 
 • A quick, clear pitch helps attract interest and support. 
 • Practicing short speeches builds confidence.
topics.Activity 1:
Elevator Speech Time
Materials Needed: Timer, notepad.
Steps to Follow:
• Choose a product or business idea.
• Practice explaining it in 60 seconds.
• Use a timer and repeat for clarity.
What Should Be Achieved:
Clear and confident pitching.
What is Gained:
• Communication
• Time management
topics.Activity 2:
Pitch Gallery Walk
Materials Needed: Poster boards, markers.
Steps to Follow:
• Write down the idea and a short pitch.
• Display them around a room.
• Walk around and read others' pitches.
What Should Be Achieved:
Exposure to different pitch styles.
What is Gained:
• Comparison skills
• Visual summarizing
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To understand how products are priced.
topics.Explanation:
• Price depends on cost, value, and audience. 
 • Entrepreneurs must balance profit and fairness. 
 • Thinking through pricing builds smart decision-making.
topics.Activity 1:
Price It Right
Materials Needed: Paper, fake money.
Steps to Follow:
• List items and guess their selling price.
• Discuss why prices are set that way.
• Try adjusting for high or low customers.
What Should Be Achieved:
Understanding of price logic.
What is Gained:
• Value judgment
• Economic thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Budgeting Game
Materials Needed: Play money, product cards.
Steps to Follow:
• Each player gets a set amount of money.
• Decide what they can buy within that budget.
• Explain choices made.
What Should Be Achieved:
Simulated consumer decision-making.
What is Gained:
• Budgeting sense
• Logical planning
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To learn how brands create identity.
topics.Explanation:
• Brands use logos, colors, and names to be memorable. 
 • A strong brand creates trust and excitement. 
 • Kids can build their own playful brand.
topics.Activity 1:
Logo Designer
Materials Needed: Crayons, paper.
Steps to Follow:
• Think of a product idea.
• Design a logo, slogan, and name.
• Explain what each represents.
What Should Be Achieved:
Creating a mini brand.
What is Gained:
• Creativity
• Symbolic thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Brand Match
Materials Needed: Printed logos and products.
Steps to Follow:
• Match logos to the correct brands.
• Discuss what feelings each brand gives.
What Should Be Achieved:
Recognizing branding impact.
What is Gained:
• Association memory
• Marketing awareness
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Explanation:
• Many businesses start with solving a problem. 
 • Identifying a problem is step one. 
 • Creating a solution builds innovation.
topics.Activity 1:
Find a Fix

Steps to Follow:
• Think about daily annoyances.
• Choose one and write how to solve it.
• Share idea with family.
What Should Be Achieved:
Awareness of real-life issues.
What is Gained:
• Problem analysis
• Design thinking
topics.Activity 2:
Pitch the Fix
Materials Needed: Timer, whiteboard.
Steps to Follow:
• Create a one-minute talk about the fix.
• Include what, why, and how.
• Present it as a pitch.
What Should Be Achieved:
Communication of solutions.
What is Gained:
• Presentation skill
• Confidence
topics.path_description: Entrepreneurial mindset and business skills development

topics.Objective: To understand customer testing.
topics.Explanation:
• Before launching, ideas are tested with real people. 
 • Getting feedback helps improve. 
 • Kids can play-test ideas in fun ways.

Try It Out
Materials Needed: Toy or paper product.
Steps to Follow:
• Make a basic version of an idea.
• Show it to 3 people.
• Ask what they liked or didn’t.
What Should Be Achieved:
Practicing feedback skills.
What is Gained:
• Listening
• Improvement mindset
topics.Activity 2:
Feedback Form Fun
Materials Needed: Printed feedback form.
Steps to Follow:
• Create simple smiley scale form.
• Ask others to fill it after testing.
• Review responses.
What Should Be Achieved:
Analyzing feedback.
What is Gained:
• Data awareness
• Refinement skills
